snippet: Under a deal negotiated with the United States, France is expected to pay $60 million to survivors for using its national railway for deportations during World War II.
abstract: United States negotiates deal with France, in which country agrees to compensate American and other Holocaust survivors who were deported via its state railway during World War II.
lead_paragraph: Under a deal negotiated with the United States, France is expected to pay $60 million to survivors for using its national railway for deportations during World War II.

headline.main: France to Pay Holocaust Survivors Over Deportations

keywords.value: SNCF (Societe Nationale des Chemins de fer Francais)
